CatDescriptText: Allen Brooks, maintenance man, Homewood , Pat Blythe, secretary, East Liverpool, Ohio, and Lynn Clark, secretary, Chester, W. Va., were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June 24, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "What do you think is the major cause (or causes) of the increase in juvenile delinquency?" Allen Brooks' answer reads: "The juveniles themselves, because they have no respect for older people...You can't put the blame on the parents, because it's the kids themselves, and they are not mentally ill."  Pat Blythe's answer reads: "I think it's the wrong upbringing in the home."  Lynn Clark's answer reads: "I think it's because they have been taught that they have to have everything and not to be respectful of what they do have."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Allen Brooks wearing varsity style jacket and cap, holding eyeglasses, standing in front of C.A. Michel sign, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Pat Blythe wearing eyeglasses and dark blouse with bow and three sets of buttons and Lynn Clark, standing in front of store window
